channel.title: Liquidity on Owl of Athena
channel.description: Recent content in Liquidity on Owl of Athena

item.title: ‘Liquidity’, a keyword in the history of capitalism: Introduction
item.description: liquidity, n.: Econ. The interchangeability of assets and money. ⊕Oxford English Dictionary, 2 ed. (1989). You don’t anywhere come right out in the open and say what liquidity is. ⊕Joan Robinson (1935) Letter to John Maynard Keynes. a highly complex phenomenon. Its concrete manifestation is powerfully affected by changes in financial institutions and practices, which have been occurring with extraordinary rapidity in recent decades. It calls for analysis both at the microeconomic and the macroeconomic level, with unusually strong dangers of committing fallacies of composition.
